problem.markdown:
>>Which of the following is the efficiency of the unreliable machine?<<
( ) \(\frac{1}{\tau}\frac{r}{r+p}\) (x) \(\frac{r}{r+p}\) ( ) \(\frac{p}{r+p}\)
[Explanation] In the general case we need to multiply the average production rate by \(\frac{1}{\tau}\) to obtain the machine's efficiency. Because it is given that the machine produces 1 part per time unit \(\tau\) = 1, \(\frac{r}{r+p}\) is both the average production rate when the machine is in State 1 (operational), *and* the efficiency of the machine. [Explanation]
